topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b72d8d6368720dd40f0000#post_53b72d8d6368720dd40f0000
[bq="Whatevs"]http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2014/06/the-pitchforks-are-coming-for-us-plutocrats-108014.html

He's wrong on some technical aspects but the thrust of what he said is true.[/bq]
He is actually damn right; I've read up on this but to summarize a bunch of technomumbojumbo basically whenever a country's economic gap increases to the point shit starts hitting the fan the first group to get shot are the super rich.

Whenever shit truly does hit the fan the super rich are the first group to get dragged out into the streets and bludgeoned to death.  In say ten to twenty years if the income gap isn't fixed and continues to grow they're going to fucking die
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b7305b6368720e45ed0000#post_53b7305b6368720e45ed0000
however, all the ways to genuinely fix the income gap will be attacked by those who complain most loudly about the income gap.

You can tax the rich with a progressive tax rate, fine, but unless you open up markets more nothing will change.

The guy who wrote that is a member of the .01% or something. An incredibly innovative guy and good businessman, not some parasite.
Welfare alone just makes people more bitter.
